7b8a0bb1-266a-4b5d-95a9-c5169603f1e7.title: Eligible to Naturalize Factsheet: Starr and Willacy County Texas
7b8a0bb1-266a-4b5d-95a9-c5169603f1e7.description: USCIS is committed to providing more information on the eligible to naturalize population. This fact sheet provides information on select characteristics of people with Lawful Permanent Residence (LPR) status, also known as Green Card holders in Starr and Willacy County Texas.

24c8d8e4-1b06-4f73-90a9-23c039759574.creator: USCIS
24c8d8e4-1b06-4f73-90a9-23c039759574.title: DHS and DOL Announce Availability of Additional H-2B Visas for Second Half of Fiscal Year
24c8d8e4-1b06-4f73-90a9-23c039759574.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) announced today the availability of an additional 35,000 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas during the second half of fiscal year (FY) 2022.

bc9a1991-d3d7-497c-982e-fe3599cb52e8.creator: USCIS
bc9a1991-d3d7-497c-982e-fe3599cb52e8.title: Two New Forms Published for Regional Center Designation
bc9a1991-d3d7-497c-982e-fe3599cb52e8.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today published two new forms for regional center designation under the EB-5 Immigrant Investor Program: Form I-956, Application for Regional Center Designation, and Form I-956H, Bona Fides of Persons Involved with Regional Center Program. Both forms are available on the USCIS website.

9da0f669-c3e7-43ff-9273-796e9b480386.creator: USCIS
9da0f669-c3e7-43ff-9273-796e9b480386.title: USCIS надає інформацію щодо «Єднання заради України»
9da0f669-c3e7-43ff-9273-796e9b480386.description: 21 квітня Сполучені Штати оголосили про започаткування програми «Єднання заради України», яка є ключовим кроком у виконанні зобов’язання президента Байдена вітати українців, які рятуються від вторгнення Росії в Україну.

4ec7c7db-cea6-4324-9677-3a86ba8f48b8.creator: USCIS
4ec7c7db-cea6-4324-9677-3a86ba8f48b8.title: USCIS Simplifying, Improving Communication of Case Processing Data
4ec7c7db-cea6-4324-9677-3a86ba8f48b8.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) announced changes to simplify and improve how the agency communicates case processing time data to the public.

cf8bdf39-27fa-4067-921e-9c351612e483.creator: USCIS
cf8bdf39-27fa-4067-921e-9c351612e483.title: USCIS Celebrates Public Service Recognition Week
cf8bdf39-27fa-4067-921e-9c351612e483.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) is honoring its dedicated workforce during Public Service Recognition Week, May 1-7. Celebrated during the first full week in May since 1985, Public Service Recognition Week is a time set aside to honor those who serve our nation as federal, state, county, and local government employees.

b4f65010-c579-4931-884b-c6e5496314ef.creator: USCIS
b4f65010-c579-4931-884b-c6e5496314ef.title: USCIS Increases Automatic Extension Period of Work Permits for Certain Applicants
b4f65010-c579-4931-884b-c6e5496314ef.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) announced a Temporary Final Rule (TFR) that increases the automatic extension period for employment authorization and Employment Authorization Documents (EADs), available to certain EAD renewal applicants, to up to 540 days.

aa8da124-4728-445f-afc4-3e5dcdb6a46a.creator: USCIS
aa8da124-4728-445f-afc4-3e5dcdb6a46a.title: USCIS Provides Information on Uniting for Ukraine
aa8da124-4728-445f-afc4-3e5dcdb6a46a.description: On April 21, the United States announced Uniting for Ukraine, a key step towards fulfilling President Biden’s commitment to welcome Ukrainians fleeing Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Uniting for Ukraine provides a pathway for displaced Ukrainian citizens and their immediate family members who are outside the United States to come to the United States and stay temporarily for a two-year period of parole.

5ea2be5a-77fa-4f66-9c27-c8f2a03f1dd7.creator: USCIS
5ea2be5a-77fa-4f66-9c27-c8f2a03f1dd7.title: DHS Announces Registration Process for Temporary Protected Status for Ukraine and Sudan
5ea2be5a-77fa-4f66-9c27-c8f2a03f1dd7.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) posted today two Federal Register notices on Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Ukraine and Sudan. These notices provide information about how to register for TPS under each country’s designation. Secretary of Homeland Security Alejandro N. Mayorkas previously announced the 18-month designation of Ukraine for TPS and the 18-month designation of Sudan for TPS.

0078b1b6-ee93-4a05-9c81-b0e07a33c609.creator: USCIS
0078b1b6-ee93-4a05-9c81-b0e07a33c609.title: Secretary Mayorkas Designates Cameroon for Temporary Protected Status for 18 Months
0078b1b6-ee93-4a05-9c81-b0e07a33c609.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced the designation of Cameroon for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months. Only individuals who are already residing in the United States as of April 14, 2022, will be eligible for TPS.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/indivi.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Enforcement and Removal, National Security
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/indivi.title: Individual arrested for threats made to schools, businesses following multiagency coordination
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/indivi.description: The teenage defendant, currently in law enforcement custody, is alleged to have made several threats claiming he was armed with a firearm and was going to “shoot up” a certain school or on his way to a certain school. The suspect is accused of offenses stemming from the numerous “swatting” calls he made to schools and businesses over the past several days. Further, he is also accused of possessing indecent images of children and distributing them across the internet.

f4fe174d-ee1b-483a-97ba-4a1315c73669.creator: USCIS
f4fe174d-ee1b-483a-97ba-4a1315c73669.title: USCIS Announces Online Filing for DACA Renewal Forms
f4fe174d-ee1b-483a-97ba-4a1315c73669.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced today that individuals who previously received deferred action under Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) may now file Form I-821D, Consideration of Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, online.

f90e190a-e392-4a61-85be-43ee34d22e1c.creator: USCIS
f90e190a-e392-4a61-85be-43ee34d22e1c.title: USCIS Implements Risk-Based Approach for Conditional Permanent Resident Interviews
f90e190a-e392-4a61-85be-43ee34d22e1c.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today announced a policy update to adopt a risk-based approach when waiving interviews for conditional permanent residents (CPR) who have filed a petition to remove the conditions on their permanent resident status.

d0f482aa-f515-4fb1-841d-f8abbf97a429.creator: USCIS
d0f482aa-f515-4fb1-841d-f8abbf97a429.title: DHS and DOL to Supplement the H-2B Cap with Additional Visas for Second Half of Fiscal Year 2022
d0f482aa-f515-4fb1-841d-f8abbf97a429.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) today announced the forthcoming publication of a joint temporary final rule to make available an additional 35,000 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for the second half of fiscal year (FY) 2022. These visas will be set aside for U.S. employers seeking to employ additional workers on or after April 1, 2022, through Sept. 30, 2022.

1e3c1543-943b-4ed0-a74a-4d088009825a.creator: USCIS
1e3c1543-943b-4ed0-a74a-4d088009825a.title: USCIS Service Center Expands Credit Card Payment Pilot Program to Most Forms
1e3c1543-943b-4ed0-a74a-4d088009825a.description: As part of our credit card payment pilot program, the USCIS service centers are now accepting credit card payments using Form G-1450, Authorization for Credit Card Transactions, for most forms.

151a4054-e389-4efe-a8ce-3d339078ee44.creator: USCIS
151a4054-e389-4efe-a8ce-3d339078ee44.title: USCIS Extends Flexibility for Responding to Agency Requests
151a4054-e389-4efe-a8ce-3d339078ee44.description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending certain flexibilities through July 25, 2022, to assist applicants, petitioners, and requestors.

1ad9d16e-02cf-42a5-8f35-f7ada85722dd.creator: USCIS
1ad9d16e-02cf-42a5-8f35-f7ada85722dd.title: USCIS Announces New Actions to Reduce Backlogs, Expand Premium Processing, and Provide Relief to Work Permit Holders
1ad9d16e-02cf-42a5-8f35-f7ada85722dd.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is announcing a trio of efforts to increase efficiency and reduce burdens to the overall legal immigration system.

38b29c33-e102-4e51-a37d-ee33ec2243df.creator: USCIS
38b29c33-e102-4e51-a37d-ee33ec2243df.title: FY 2023 H-1B Cap Season Updates
38b29c33-e102-4e51-a37d-ee33ec2243df.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has received enough electronic registrations during the initial registration period to reach the fiscal year (FY) 2023 H-1B numerical allocations (H-1B cap), including the advanced degree exemption (master’s cap).

34ef8d7e-d7e9-41b1-b228-45addc870bec.creator: USCIS
34ef8d7e-d7e9-41b1-b228-45addc870bec.title: DHS and DOJ Issue Rule to Efficiently and Fairly Process Asylum Claims
34ef8d7e-d7e9-41b1-b228-45addc870bec.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Department of Justice (DOJ) are issuing a rule to improve and expedite processing of asylum claims made by noncitizens subject to expedited removal, ensuring that those who are eligible for asylum are granted relief quickly, and those who are not are promptly removed.

8fa710ba-71b0-4ba4-89c9-4e6cb33b85f0.creator: USCIS
8fa710ba-71b0-4ba4-89c9-4e6cb33b85f0.title: Naturalization Fact Sheet For Lawful Permanent Residents Who had T or U Nonimmigrant Status
8fa710ba-71b0-4ba4-89c9-4e6cb33b85f0.description: USCIS is committed to helping Green Card holders understand the naturalization process. This fact sheet provides information to lawful permanent residents who had T or U nonimmigrant status.

c0597de4-ab03-42bb-8e25-0b1e128d8ef8.creator: USCIS
c0597de4-ab03-42bb-8e25-0b1e128d8ef8.title: Naturalization Fact Sheet for Lawful Permanent Residents Who Had Asylee or Refugee Status
c0597de4-ab03-42bb-8e25-0b1e128d8ef8.description: USCIS is committed to helping Green Card holders understand the naturalization process. This fact sheet provides information to lawful permanent residents who had asylee and refugee status.

3341c947-f610-4eba-9c76-375b0b942dce.creator: USCIS
3341c947-f610-4eba-9c76-375b0b942dce.title: Securing U.S. Citizenship for Your Child, Information for Adoptive Parents of Children Issued IH-4 and IR-4 Visas Fact Sheet
3341c947-f610-4eba-9c76-375b0b942dce.description: USCIS is committed to helping Green Card holders understand the naturalization process. This fact sheet provides information to adoptive parents whose children were issued IH-4 and IR-4 visas.

3603199b-7109-43da-b943-e53424d8c1cb.creator: USCIS
3603199b-7109-43da-b943-e53424d8c1cb.title: Naturalization Fact Sheet for VAWA Lawful Permanent Residents
3603199b-7109-43da-b943-e53424d8c1cb.description: USCIS is committed to helping Green Card holders understand the naturalization process. This fact sheet provides information to VAWA lawful permanent residents.

bd231e8f-11d0-44ab-9d40-583082cd4e66.creator: USCIS
bd231e8f-11d0-44ab-9d40-583082cd4e66.title: Naturalization Fact Sheet for Special Immigrant Juveniles (SIJS)
bd231e8f-11d0-44ab-9d40-583082cd4e66.description: USCIS is committed to helping Green Card holders understand the naturalization process. This fact sheet provides information to special immigrant juveniles.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-op.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Operational, Professional Responsibility
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-op.title: ICE OPR led investigation results in the sentencing of a former south Texas attorney for his role in a detainee bribery scheme
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-op.description: Roel Alanis, 32, of McAllen, Texas, was sentenced March 22 to 30 months in federal prison followed by three years of supervised release. At the hearing, the court noted how the serious violation of his conduct and the series of continuing bribes in return for noncitizen rosters he received merited some incarceration time.  Alanis pleaded guilty on April 27, 2021.

61159.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Professional Responsibility
61159.title: ICE OPR led investigation results in the sentencing of a former south Texas attorney for his role in a detainee bribery scheme
61159.description: Roel Alanis, 32, of McAllen, Texas, was sentenced March 22 to 30 months in federal prison followed by three years of supervised release. At the hearing, the court noted how the serious violation of his conduct and the series of continuing bribes in return for noncitizen rosters he received merited some incarceration time.  Alanis pleaded guilty on April 27, 2021.

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/texas-.creator: ICE Headline News Feed by Category - Enforcement and Removal, National Security
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/texas-.title: Texas man pleads guilty to conspiring to steal more than $2.1 million in sensitive military equipment following ICE HSI, US Army CID investigation
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/texas-.description: Nathan Nichols, a 46-year-old Corpus Christi resident, pleaded guilty March 21 in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas to conspiring with others to steal $2,176,000 in sensitive military equipment from U.S. Army Garrison Ft. Hood in June 2021.

8357848f-302c-4309-9df7-ed4b44a6c5cf.creator: USCIS
8357848f-302c-4309-9df7-ed4b44a6c5cf.title: USCIS Updates Guidance on Employment Authorization for E and L Nonimmigrant Spouses
8357848f-302c-4309-9df7-ed4b44a6c5cf.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is updating guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to address the documentation that certain E and L nonimmigrant spouses may use as evidence of employment authorization based on their nonimmigrant status.

d39fa64e-40da-4ebe-ba81-e4a94202d273.creator: USCIS
d39fa64e-40da-4ebe-ba81-e4a94202d273.title: USCIS Urges Eligible Individuals to Consider Applying for Adjustment of Status in the EB-2 Category Based on the April Visa Bulletin Date for Filing for India
d39fa64e-40da-4ebe-ba81-e4a94202d273.description: In the recently published April Visa Bulletin, the Department of State advanced the Date for Filing (also known as the application date) applications for an immigrant visa or adjustment of status in the employment-based, second preference (EB-2) category for India from Sept. 1, 2013, to Sept. 1, 2014.

08efa447-2450-4c1f-895b-0c5717b27fd6.creator: USCIS
08efa447-2450-4c1f-895b-0c5717b27fd6.title: Secretary Mayorkas Designates Afghanistan for Temporary Protected Status
08efa447-2450-4c1f-895b-0c5717b27fd6.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) today announced the designation of Afghanistan for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months. Only individuals who are already residing in the United States as of March 15, 2022, will be eligible for TPS.

de932fb1-4900-4aa4-bebb-0bbe8c272a31.creator: USCIS
de932fb1-4900-4aa4-bebb-0bbe8c272a31.title: USCIS Announces Policies to Better Protect Immigrant Children Who Have Been Abused, Neglected, or Abandoned
de932fb1-4900-4aa4-bebb-0bbe8c272a31.description: United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today announced new policies that will provide better protection to immigrant children who are victims of abuse, neglect, abandonment, or similar parental maltreatment.

a3b1822a-a441-4fda-9438-fd4678c0ad38.creator: USCIS
a3b1822a-a441-4fda-9438-fd4678c0ad38.title: USCIS to Offer Deferred Action for Special Immigrant Juveniles
a3b1822a-a441-4fda-9438-fd4678c0ad38.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced that it is updating the USCIS Policy Manual to consider deferred action and related employment authorization for noncitizens who have an approved Form I-360, Petition for Amerasian, Widow(er), or Special Immigrant, for Special Immigrant Juvenile (SIJ) classification but who cannot apply to adjust status to become a lawful permanent resident (LPR) because a visa number is not available.

90eed762-6f2f-4281-9b56-e707ab6f66a2.creator: USCIS
90eed762-6f2f-4281-9b56-e707ab6f66a2.title: Immigration Help Available to Those Affected by Special Situations, Including the Invasion of Ukraine
90eed762-6f2f-4281-9b56-e707ab6f66a2.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services reminds the public that we offer immigration services that may help people affected by extreme situations, including the invasion of Ukraine.

62b39794-5884-4a2d-ba56-1f95343837d5.creator: USCIS
62b39794-5884-4a2d-ba56-1f95343837d5.title: Secretary Mayorkas Designates Ukraine for Temporary Protected Status for 18 Months
62b39794-5884-4a2d-ba56-1f95343837d5.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced the designation of Ukraine for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months.

2d61f864-86f7-4c27-bb4c-8b84c54a5a7f.creator: USCIS
2d61f864-86f7-4c27-bb4c-8b84c54a5a7f.title: Secretary Mayorkas Designates Sudan and Extends and Redesignates South Sudan for Temporary Protected Status
2d61f864-86f7-4c27-bb4c-8b84c54a5a7f.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced a new designation of Sudan and an extension and redesignation of South Sudan for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 18 months.

465c53b5-7acb-47bc-97ee-1bca5bba8ba3.creator: USCIS
465c53b5-7acb-47bc-97ee-1bca5bba8ba3.title: USCIS Expands Credit Card Payment Pilot Program to All Service Centers
465c53b5-7acb-47bc-97ee-1bca5bba8ba3.description: As part of our credit card payment pilot program, the USCIS service centers are now accepting credit card payments using Form G-1450, Authorization for Credit Card Transactions, for all forms except Form I-129, Petition for a Nonimmigrant Worker, for H-1B and H-2A petitions.

fd3440a7-f8ac-4639-a461-8b6d7f0058b5.creator: USCIS
fd3440a7-f8ac-4639-a461-8b6d7f0058b5.title: H-2B Cap Reached for Second Half of FY 2022
fd3440a7-f8ac-4639-a461-8b6d7f0058b5.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has received enough petitions to meet the congressionally mandated H-2B cap for the second half of fiscal year (FY) 2022.

7e7b1906-3bc2-4736-9214-f82db53dfac9.creator: USCIS
7e7b1906-3bc2-4736-9214-f82db53dfac9.title: USCIS Reaches Fiscal Year 2022 H-1B Cap
7e7b1906-3bc2-4736-9214-f82db53dfac9.description: USCIS has received a sufficient number of petitions needed to reach the congressionally mandated 65,000 H-1B visa regular cap and the 20,000 H-1B visa U.S. advanced degree exemption, known as the master’s cap, for fiscal year (FY) 2022.

7854677c-08c2-4b83-83b7-6ecc6c75b8d5.creator: USCIS
7854677c-08c2-4b83-83b7-6ecc6c75b8d5.title: USCIS Launches H-2A Employer Data Hub
7854677c-08c2-4b83-83b7-6ecc6c75b8d5.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has launched an H-2A Employer Data Hub to provide information to the public on employers or agents petitioning for H-2A workers.

https://www.cbp.gov/node/375901.creator: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
https://www.cbp.gov/node/375901.title: Civil Rights and Civil Liberties
https://www.cbp.gov/node/375901.description: In addition to its commitment to diversity, inclusion, and nondiscrimination in the workforce, CBP is committed to preserving individual liberty, fairness and equality under the law in the conduct of its primary mission of securing the nation.…

b34ea644-f7ee-4ea4-afe7-e024d21591b2.creator: USCIS
b34ea644-f7ee-4ea4-afe7-e024d21591b2.title: USCIS Urges Eligible Applicants to Switch  Employment-Based Categories
b34ea644-f7ee-4ea4-afe7-e024d21591b2.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services encourages eligible applicants to consider requesting to transfer the underlying basis of their adjustment of status application to the first (priority workers) or second (noncitizens in professions with advanced degrees or with exceptional ability) employment-based preference categories, because there is an exceptionally high number of employment-based immigrant visas available in these categories during this fiscal year (October 2021 through September 2022).

affb605d-e077-4390-b639-05c04575ae79.creator: USCIS
affb605d-e077-4390-b639-05c04575ae79.title: DHS Proposes Fair and Humane Public Charge Rule
affb605d-e077-4390-b639-05c04575ae79.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) will issue a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) that would regulate how DHS applies the public charge ground of inadmissibility. The proposed rule would provide fair and humane treatment for noncitizens requesting admission to the United States or applying for lawful permanent residence from within the United States. DHS has posted an advance copy of the proposed rule. The official version will publish in the Federal Register in the coming days.

98e632c3-8f83-4852-8ef1-83094731a644.creator: USCIS
98e632c3-8f83-4852-8ef1-83094731a644.title: USCIS Opens a New Lockbox Facility
98e632c3-8f83-4852-8ef1-83094731a644.description: As we announced in November 2021, we have opened a new lockbox facility in Elgin, Illinois. We are beginning to transition incoming work to the new location.

e2e70f17-7a1f-4f22-9fe0-befcd6c45c54.creator: USCIS
e2e70f17-7a1f-4f22-9fe0-befcd6c45c54.title: USCIS Updates Policy Guidance on VAWA Self-Petitions
e2e70f17-7a1f-4f22-9fe0-befcd6c45c54.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is publishing policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual on eligibility, filing, and adjudication requirements addressing Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) self-petitions to update practices and align USCIS policies with recent court decisions.

896ade93-903e-454b-824e-43f207a996f3.creator: USCIS
896ade93-903e-454b-824e-43f207a996f3.title: USCIS Announces New Agency Mission Statement
896ade93-903e-454b-824e-43f207a996f3.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director Ur M. Jaddou announced the agency’s new mission statement. Last year, USCIS leadership empowered employees to submit words that they felt best illustrated the agency’s work. The new mission statement is a reflection of this feedback from the workforce, the priorities of the Biden Administration, and Director Jaddou’s vision for an inclusive and accessible agency.

f16bf57a-d2a2-48ac-b03c-31c741748df0.creator: USCIS
f16bf57a-d2a2-48ac-b03c-31c741748df0.title: USCIS Issues Policy Guidance Regarding Exemptions from the Temporary Need Requirement for H-2B Workers on Guam and the CNMI Under the FY 2021 National Defense Authorization Act
f16bf57a-d2a2-48ac-b03c-31c741748df0.description: USCIS is issuing updated policy guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual to clarify how petitioners may demonstrate that they qualify for an exemption from the temporary need requirement for a nonimmigrant visa petition for a temporary nonagricultural H-2B worker on Guam and in the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI) that falls under the Fiscal Year 2021 National Defense Authorization Act.

https://www.cbp.gov/node/375626.creator: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
https://www.cbp.gov/node/375626.title: Global Entry for Citizens of Brazil
https://www.cbp.gov/node/375626.description:
How to Apply for Global Entry:

In order to apply for Global Entry, citizens of Brazil can apply for Global Entry through CBP's Trusted Traveler Programs (TTP) website.

Application Process:


	Apply Online: Complete a TTP online…

711b88cd-6ea2-4119-8b3c-a12fb0b6d5cc.creator: USCIS
711b88cd-6ea2-4119-8b3c-a12fb0b6d5cc.title: USCIS Updates Guidelines on Maximum Validity Periods for New Employment Authorization Documents for Certain Applicants
711b88cd-6ea2-4119-8b3c-a12fb0b6d5cc.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today published updated policy guidance to change the maximum validity period that may be granted for Employment Authorization Documents (EADs) issued to certain applicants, as well as to provide general guidance on adjudicating Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization.

29a19c26-3ce6-46c2-b2f7-8e057aa885bd.creator: USCIS
29a19c26-3ce6-46c2-b2f7-8e057aa885bd.title: USCIS Statement on the International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation
29a19c26-3ce6-46c2-b2f7-8e057aa885bd.description: On Feb. 6, the International Day of Zero Tolerance for Female Genital Mutilation, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services joins other U.S. government agencies and the international community in calling for an end to the practice of female genital mutilation or cutting (FGM/C).

1c6d44f2-dc79-4f7e-9c62-6ab7d53b2f07.creator: USCIS
1c6d44f2-dc79-4f7e-9c62-6ab7d53b2f07.title: Executive Order Anniversary Fact Sheet
1c6d44f2-dc79-4f7e-9c62-6ab7d53b2f07.description: USCIS is recognizing the one-year anniversary of several executive orders (EO) that impact USCIS and highlighting the progress we have made so far.

39fef9bb-f969-49f2-8bfb-9c514233d66b.creator: USCIS
39fef9bb-f969-49f2-8bfb-9c514233d66b.title: Readout of Director Ur M. Jaddou’s Virtual Briefing with Stakeholders to Mark One-Year Anniversary of Executive Orders Aimed at Restoring Faith in Our Immigration System
39fef9bb-f969-49f2-8bfb-9c514233d66b.description: Yesterday, on the one-year anniversary of several executive orders (EOs) from the Biden-Harris administration aimed at restoring faith in our nation’s legal immigration system, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) Director Ur M. Jaddou briefed national stakeholders on the agency’s efforts to implement these EOs.

2b336615-1a7c-43be-be78-d7689253d5b2.creator: USCIS
2b336615-1a7c-43be-be78-d7689253d5b2.title: USCIS Updates Medical Examination Guidance for Afghan Parolees Arriving Under Operation Allies Welcome (OAW)
2b336615-1a7c-43be-be78-d7689253d5b2.description: USCIS announced today that it is updating guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual regarding immigration medical examination requirements for certain Afghan nationals applying for adjustment of status after arriving in the United States under Operation Allies Welcome (OAW).

79665d65-1b8b-4cba-8d9a-a568d05ad614.creator: USCIS
79665d65-1b8b-4cba-8d9a-a568d05ad614.title: FY 2023 H-1B Cap Initial Registration Period Opens on March 1
79665d65-1b8b-4cba-8d9a-a568d05ad614.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced that the initial registration period for the fiscal year 2023 H-1B cap will open at noon Eastern on March 1 and run through noon Eastern on March 18, 2022.

284d7111-0ca5-4ee1-9834-fcef8e50e519.creator: USCIS
284d7111-0ca5-4ee1-9834-fcef8e50e519.title: DHS Announces Availability of Additional H-2B Visas for First Half of Fiscal Year
284d7111-0ca5-4ee1-9834-fcef8e50e519.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) today announced the availability of 20,000 additional H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for the first half of fiscal year (FY) 2022.

4dda5316-bc73-46f0-954f-c38c691f6873.creator: USCIS
4dda5316-bc73-46f0-954f-c38c691f6873.title: USCIS Updates Guidance on Expedite Requests
4dda5316-bc73-46f0-954f-c38c691f6873.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has updated the USCIS Policy Manual to reflect new guidance on how we determine whether a case warrants expedited treatment.

dffd97bf-f94e-465e-bae5-3d911d379c8f.creator: USCIS
dffd97bf-f94e-465e-bae5-3d911d379c8f.title: USCIS Updates Guidance on National Interest Waivers
dffd97bf-f94e-465e-bae5-3d911d379c8f.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced updated guidance on adjudicating requests for “National Interest Waivers” regarding job offer and labor certification requirements for certain advanced degree professionals and individuals of exceptional ability.

e8353f26-2ec2-410c-9b2b-e4aa2f39fadb.creator: USCIS
e8353f26-2ec2-410c-9b2b-e4aa2f39fadb.title: USCIS Provides Clarifying Guidance for O-1 Petitions with a Focus on STEM Fields
e8353f26-2ec2-410c-9b2b-e4aa2f39fadb.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today issued policy guidance clarifying how it evaluates evidence to determine eligibility for O-1A nonimmigrants of extraordinary ability, with a focus on petitions filed for individuals in science, technology, engineering, or math (STEM) fields, as well as how USCIS determines whether an O-1 beneficiary’s prospective work is within their area of extraordinary ability or achievement.

ea2d2f87-70c9-40df-b029-eada5d7ef67f.creator: USCIS
ea2d2f87-70c9-40df-b029-eada5d7ef67f.title: USCIS Provides Clarifying Guidance on O-1 Nonimmigrants in Arts vs. Motion Picture and Television
ea2d2f87-70c9-40df-b029-eada5d7ef67f.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced clarifying guidance on how we determine whether an O-1B beneficiary will be evaluated as a person of extraordinary ability in the arts or as a person of extraordinary achievement in the motion picture or television industry when a case has elements of both.

6fa4e98a-5070-4d8c-8443-259365e72f4f.creator: USCIS
6fa4e98a-5070-4d8c-8443-259365e72f4f.title: Immigration Help Available to Those Affected by Natural Disasters and Other Unforeseen Circumstances
6fa4e98a-5070-4d8c-8443-259365e72f4f.description: USCIS is reminding the public that we offer immigration services that may help people affected by unforeseen circumstances such as natural disasters. Examples of unforeseen circumstances include, but are not limited to, the Marshall fire in Colorado.

cb47d756-1bae-42e3-9cd1-c7521822310c.creator: USCIS
cb47d756-1bae-42e3-9cd1-c7521822310c.title: USCIS Extends Flexibility for Responding to Agency Requests
cb47d756-1bae-42e3-9cd1-c7521822310c.description: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending the flexibilities it announced on March 30, 2020.

4c52b11b-1cce-4093-a2df-f2f11c67e119.creator: USCIS
4c52b11b-1cce-4093-a2df-f2f11c67e119.title: DHS Withdraws H-1B Selection Final Rule
4c52b11b-1cce-4093-a2df-f2f11c67e119.description: The Department of Homeland Security has published a final rule that withdraws the Modification of Registration Requirement for Petitioners Seeking to File Cap-Subject H-1B Petitions final rule, also known as the H-1B Selection Final Rule, issued Jan. 8, 2021.

76786c4b-ff3d-4dd9-aaee-b548056a181a.creator: USCIS
76786c4b-ff3d-4dd9-aaee-b548056a181a.title: For First Time, DHS to Supplement H-2B Cap with Additional Visas in First Half of Fiscal Year
76786c4b-ff3d-4dd9-aaee-b548056a181a.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Department of Labor (DOL) today announced the forthcoming publication of a joint temporary final rule to make available an additional 20,000 H-2B temporary nonagricultural worker visas for fiscal year (FY) 2022.

efe2d5b7-9625-4a68-a0f3-4c8a269dbe60.creator: USCIS
efe2d5b7-9625-4a68-a0f3-4c8a269dbe60.title: USCIS Announces FY 2021 Accomplishments
efe2d5b7-9625-4a68-a0f3-4c8a269dbe60.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is releasing preliminary fiscal year (FY) 2021 agency statistics and accomplishments. These preliminary statistics highlight important immigration trends and illustrate the work accomplished by USCIS in FY 2021. The agency will publish final, verified FY 2021 statistics in January 2022.

3ca8e4d6-576e-4bf6-8cdf-c83ff54a33de.creator: USCIS
3ca8e4d6-576e-4bf6-8cdf-c83ff54a33de.title: Immigration Help Available to Those Affected by Natural Disasters and Other Unforeseen Circumstances
3ca8e4d6-576e-4bf6-8cdf-c83ff54a33de.description: USCIS is reminding the public that we offer immigration services that may help people affected by unforeseen circumstances such as natural disasters. Examples of unforeseen circumstances include, but are not limited to, the recent tornadoes in Kentucky and surrounding states.

593fc11b-62a1-44f0-9b9c-3997728b69bc.creator: USCIS
593fc11b-62a1-44f0-9b9c-3997728b69bc.title: USCIS Reverts to Previous Criteria for Interviewing Petitioners Requesting Derivative Refugee and Asylee Status for Family Members
593fc11b-62a1-44f0-9b9c-3997728b69bc.description: USCIS is rescinding a November 2020 policy memorandum requiring interviews of all petitioners filing Form I-730, Refugee/Asylee Relative Petition. Effective immediately, USCIS will return to its prior long-standing practice of making case-by-case determinations on whether to interview Form I-730 petitioners.

17b4c21c-6d91-4a9b-9069-49f4eb8bf0c5.creator: USCIS
17b4c21c-6d91-4a9b-9069-49f4eb8bf0c5.title: USCIS Temporarily Waiving 60-Day Rule for Civil Surgeon Signatures
17b4c21c-6d91-4a9b-9069-49f4eb8bf0c5.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is temporarily waiving the requirement that the civil surgeon sign Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record, no more than 60 days before an applicant files an application for the underlying immigration benefit (including Form I-485, Application to Register Permanent Residence or Adjust Status), until Sept. 30, 2022.

d81d583a-132a-4416-884c-78360b56c7e7.creator: USCIS
d81d583a-132a-4416-884c-78360b56c7e7.title: USCIS Extends Transitional Parole for CNMI Long-Term Resident Status Applicants
d81d583a-132a-4416-884c-78360b56c7e7.description: USCIS announced today that it will automatically extend parole and employment authorization, if applicable, for parolees who timely applied for Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI) long-term resident status.

https://www.cbp.gov/node/374321.creator: U.S. Customs and Border Protection
https://www.cbp.gov/node/374321.title: User Fee Facilities Program
https://www.cbp.gov/node/374321.description: The User Fee Facilities Program was established on October 30, 1984 to provide a mechanism for airports, seaports, and other facilities whose “volume or value of business cleared through such airport, seaport, or other facility is insufficient to…

fbc64516-c2ad-468d-8cca-cf00d6205040.creator: USCIS
fbc64516-c2ad-468d-8cca-cf00d6205040.title: All Temporary Protected Status (TPS) Applicants May Now File Forms I-821 and I-765 Online
fbc64516-c2ad-468d-8cca-cf00d6205040.description: As of Nov. 29, all applicants eligible to file for TPS under one of the current designations may file Form I-821, Application for Temporary Protected Status, and Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization, online.

1f262c77-7f84-4950-90f0-9f3323384995.creator: USCIS
1f262c77-7f84-4950-90f0-9f3323384995.title: USCIS Incorporates General Adjudications Guidance into the Policy Manual
1f262c77-7f84-4950-90f0-9f3323384995.description: We are incorporating existing guidance from the Adjudicator’s Field Manual (AFM) into the USCIS Policy Manual.

464cf7f4-0869-4954-b18b-ea35276d2139.creator: USCIS
464cf7f4-0869-4954-b18b-ea35276d2139.title: Certain Petitioners for U Nonimmigrant Status May Receive a Refund for Applications for Employment Authorization Submitted Before Sept. 30, 2021
464cf7f4-0869-4954-b18b-ea35276d2139.description: USCIS mistakenly rejected certain applications for employment authorization (Form I-765, Application for Employment Authorization) from petitioners for U nonimmigrant status that were filed without a fee (or request for fee waiver) from June 14 through Sept. 29, 2021.

9c521a75-430c-421a-b6d2-793bf1aeb8ba.creator: USCIS
9c521a75-430c-421a-b6d2-793bf1aeb8ba.title: USCIS Conducts Third Random Selection from Previously Submitted FY 2022 H-1B Cap Registrations
9c521a75-430c-421a-b6d2-793bf1aeb8ba.description: We recently determined that we needed to select additional registrations to reach the fiscal year (FY) 2022 H-1B numerical allocations, including the advanced degree exemption.

82542d27-b165-4e97-adde-6e3bccfd23e1.creator: USCIS
82542d27-b165-4e97-adde-6e3bccfd23e1.title: USCIS Opening a New Lockbox Facility
82542d27-b165-4e97-adde-6e3bccfd23e1.description: We are planning to open a new facility in Elgin, Illinois, next year to expand our lockbox capability.

b6560ba9-b704-48a0-ae62-95e5f8e18d93.creator: USCIS
b6560ba9-b704-48a0-ae62-95e5f8e18d93.title: DHS Announces Countries Eligible for H-2A and H-2B Visa Programs
b6560ba9-b704-48a0-ae62-95e5f8e18d93.description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS), in consultation with the Department of State (DOS), has announced the lists of countries whose nationals are eligible to participate in the H-2A and H-2B visa programs in the next year.

20ec0c73-38df-46ed-94d2-ddeefcd32480.creator: USCIS
20ec0c73-38df-46ed-94d2-ddeefcd32480.title: DHS Announces Fee Exemptions, Streamlined Processing for Afghan Nationals as They Resettle in the U.S.
20ec0c73-38df-46ed-94d2-ddeefcd32480.description: Today, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced that it will exempt filing fees and streamline application processing for Afghan nationals who were paroled into the United States for humanitarian reasons on or after July 30, 2021.

ec8f6b3c-6d56-41fe-8a67-b0644c3b1219.creator: USCIS
ec8f6b3c-6d56-41fe-8a67-b0644c3b1219.title: USCIS Commemorates Veterans Day with Special Naturalization Ceremonies
ec8f6b3c-6d56-41fe-8a67-b0644c3b1219.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will honor Veterans Day this year by holding more than 90 ceremonies naturalizing more than 4,440 current and former members of the military and their families.

acfc61e7-d0be-4de8-aeb0-751ff7662b8b.creator: USCIS
acfc61e7-d0be-4de8-aeb0-751ff7662b8b.title: USCIS Expands Credit Card Payment Pilot Program to  California Service Center
acfc61e7-d0be-4de8-aeb0-751ff7662b8b.description: As part of our credit card payment pilot program, the California Service Center is now accepting credit card payments using Form G-1450, Authorization for Credit Card Transactions, for petitioners filing Form I-129, Petition for a Nonimmigrant Worker, for O and P nonimmigrants.

b9b961aa-e45e-456f-b12f-cb9960278de8.creator: USCIS
b9b961aa-e45e-456f-b12f-cb9960278de8.title: Policy Update: Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness (LRIF)
b9b961aa-e45e-456f-b12f-cb9960278de8.description: USCIS has expanded its guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual about Liberian Refugee Immigration Fairness (LRIF) to clarify steps applicants must take if they cannot submit primary evidence of Liberian nationality to support an LRIF-based application for adjustment of status.

8c9c5d71-e8cb-43e9-8858-8af83e9b6633.creator: USCIS
8c9c5d71-e8cb-43e9-8858-8af83e9b6633.title: Directions for Class Members Filing Motions to Reopen Pursuant to Settlement Agreement in H-1B Market Research Analyst Class Action Litigation
8c9c5d71-e8cb-43e9-8858-8af83e9b6633.description: USCIS reached a settlement agreement [PDF] in the case of MadKudu Inc., et al. v. U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, et al., No. 20-cv-2653 (N.D. Cal.). On Oct. 19, 2021, the U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, San Jose Division, granted final approval of the settlement agreement. This agreement outlines new, overarching guidance for adjudicating pending or future H-1B petitions for market research analysts.

d294c885-de17-4ad8-a23c-8c1b25b83ebe.creator: USCIS
d294c885-de17-4ad8-a23c-8c1b25b83ebe.title: USCIS Expands Credit Card Payment Pilot Program to  Vermont Service Center
d294c885-de17-4ad8-a23c-8c1b25b83ebe.description: As part of our credit card payment pilot program, the Vermont Service Center is now accepting credit card payments using Form G-1450, Authorization for Credit Card Transactions, for petitioners filing Form I-129, Petition for a Nonimmigrant Worker, for O and P nonimmigrants.

382a9900-4c77-43e1-b0f6-d58a4b802743.creator: USCIS
382a9900-4c77-43e1-b0f6-d58a4b802743.title: USCIS Implements Employment Authorization for Individuals Covered by Deferred Enforced Departure for Hong Kong Residents
382a9900-4c77-43e1-b0f6-d58a4b802743.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) today issued a Federal Register notice with information on how to apply for employment authorization for eligible Hong Kong residents covered under the president’s Aug. 5 memorandum directing Deferred Enforced Departure (DED) for 18 months, through Feb. 5, 2023.

5b9d6eda-07f0-4f35-a127-5b93366950e7.creator: USCIS
5b9d6eda-07f0-4f35-a127-5b93366950e7.title: USCIS Issues Updated and Comprehensive Guidance on T Visa Adjudications
5b9d6eda-07f0-4f35-a127-5b93366950e7.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is issuing updated and comprehensive guidance in the USCIS Policy Manual on adjudicating applications for T nonimmigrant status (or T visas) submitted by victims of human trafficking, including clarifying how applicants establish eligibility.

e4480a85-0768-488a-b7ff-8bb11d2d787d.creator: USCIS
e4480a85-0768-488a-b7ff-8bb11d2d787d.title: USCIS Reaches H-2B Cap for First Half of FY 2022
e4480a85-0768-488a-b7ff-8bb11d2d787d.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has received enough petitions to reach the congressionally mandated cap on H-2B visas for temporary nonagricultural workers for the first half of fiscal year 2022.

2983f63b-9867-47dc-b6ab-2ba280dc39f1.creator: USCIS
2983f63b-9867-47dc-b6ab-2ba280dc39f1.title: Most CW-1 Employers Must File Required Semiannual Report (Form I-129CWR)
2983f63b-9867-47dc-b6ab-2ba280dc39f1.description: USCIS reminds employers of Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands (CNMI) Transitional Workers (CW-1) that, if you have a currently-approved CW-1 petition with a validity period of six months or more, you must file Form I-129CWR, Semiannual Report for CW-1 Employers, with USCIS every six months after the petition validity start date.

ef855dc3-0767-469b-8e74-06f63bb10008.creator: USCIS
ef855dc3-0767-469b-8e74-06f63bb10008.title: DHS waxay ku dhawaaqdey kordhinta iyo dib u qaabeynta Soomaaliya Xaalada Si kumeel gaadhka ah in loo ilaaliyo
ef855dc3-0767-469b-8e74-06f63bb10008.description: Waaxda Amniga Gudaha ayaa maanta daabacday ogeysiiska Diiwaangelinta Federaalka (FRN) oo ku kordhisay isla markaana dib u habeyn ku sameyneysa Xaalada ku meelgaadhka ah ee Ilaalinta Somaaliya (TPS) ilaa 18 bilood, laga bilaabo 18 Sebtember, 2021, illaa 17 Maarso, 2023.

cfe8eff3-0ce5-4b53-b094-a70864a63d08.creator: USCIS
cfe8eff3-0ce5-4b53-b094-a70864a63d08.title: USCIS Extends Flexibility for Responding to Agency Requests
cfe8eff3-0ce5-4b53-b094-a70864a63d08.description: In response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is extending the flexibilities it announced on March 30, 2020.

9b6d5e35-56c8-4a2a-b233-aebc3bee9cc6.creator: USCIS
9b6d5e35-56c8-4a2a-b233-aebc3bee9cc6.title: USCIS Awards FY 2021 Citizenship and Integration Grants
9b6d5e35-56c8-4a2a-b233-aebc3bee9cc6.description: Nearly $10 Million Will Expand Citizenship Preparation Services in 25 States

608d8f31-d02d-4eaa-995f-b561bc451a07.creator: USCIS
608d8f31-d02d-4eaa-995f-b561bc451a07.title: Characteristics of People Who Naturalized Between FY 2015 and FY 2019
608d8f31-d02d-4eaa-995f-b561bc451a07.description: Over 3.7 million people became U.S. citizens between fiscal years (FY) 2015 and 2019.1 This fact sheet summarizes data from U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) naturalization records to provide information on the demographic characteristics of these new citizens.

76fd0771-0a5b-46d8-b4a5-600dd5040f98.creator: USCIS
76fd0771-0a5b-46d8-b4a5-600dd5040f98.title: USCIS to Welcome 21,000 New Citizens in Celebration of  Constitution Day and Citizenship Day
76fd0771-0a5b-46d8-b4a5-600dd5040f98.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services will celebrate Constitution Day and Citizenship Day this year by welcoming 21,000 new citizens in 335 naturalization ceremonies across the country between Sept. 17 and 23.

e9535f94-a82e-4e54-bae5-8877b0f39a39.creator: USCIS
e9535f94-a82e-4e54-bae5-8877b0f39a39.title: USCIS Expands Credit Card Payment Pilot Program to Texas Service Center
e9535f94-a82e-4e54-bae5-8877b0f39a39.description: As part of our credit card payment pilot program, the Texas Service Center is now accepting credit card payments using Form G-1450, Authorization for Credit Card Transactions, for petitioners filing Form I-140, Immigrant Petition for Alien Workers, with Form I-907, Request for Premium Processing Service, or when filing Form I-907 to upgrade a pending Form I-140 to premium processing.

e2af35e8-68fe-4b50-bba9-9534030a5ede.creator: USCIS
e2af35e8-68fe-4b50-bba9-9534030a5ede.title: USCIS Naturalization Policies Fact Sheet
e2af35e8-68fe-4b50-bba9-9534030a5ede.description: The Biden-Harris administration is committed to making the naturalization process both welcoming and accessible to all who are eligible. As part of that effort, President Biden issued Executive Order 14012: Restoring Faith in Our Legal Immigration System and Strengthening Integration and Inclusion Efforts for New Americans.

09342624-c583-4478-902f-a2c099b95a0b.creator: USCIS
09342624-c583-4478-902f-a2c099b95a0b.title: COVID-19 Vaccination Required for Immigration Medical Examinations
09342624-c583-4478-902f-a2c099b95a0b.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services today announced that, effective Oct. 1, 2021, applicants subject to the immigration medical examination must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 before the civil surgeon can complete an immigration medical examination and sign Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record.

bd321e5e-6f07-4c6c-b062-99533dd71600.title: USCIS Reaches Settlement Agreement in “No Blank Space Rejection Policy” Case
bd321e5e-6f07-4c6c-b062-99533dd71600.description: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services reached a settlement agreement in the case of Vangala et al. v. USCIS et al., No. 4:20-cv-08143(N.D. Cal.). The agreement allows certain individuals to receive updated receipt dates for resubmitted immigration benefit applications or petitions originally rejected under the former “No Blank Space” rejection policy.

7d8b0649-7598-49d8-b19b-eae8670dcedf.title: Cap Reached for Remaining H-2B Visas for Returning Workers for FY 2021
7d8b0649-7598-49d8-b19b-eae8670dcedf.description: As of Aug. 13, 2021, USCIS has received enough petitions for returning workers to reach the additional 22,000 H-2B visas made available under the FY 2021 H-2B supplemental visa temporary final rule.

96107430-5225-47a8-83de-015dae0dafc4.creator: USCIS
96107430-5225-47a8-83de-015dae0dafc4.title: DHS and DOJ Publish Notice of Proposed Rulemaking to Make Asylum Process More Efficient and Ensure Fairness
96107430-5225-47a8-83de-015dae0dafc4.description: In a key step toward implementing the Administration’s blueprint for a fair, orderly, and humane immigration system, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and Department of Justice (DOJ) are publishing a notice of proposed rulemaking (NPRM) that would amend current regulations to improve the processing of asylum claims.

ca59fbdc-07fc-48f5-abcc-62ab4653f336.creator: USCIS
ca59fbdc-07fc-48f5-abcc-62ab4653f336.title: USCIS Temporarily Extending Validity Period of Form I-693
ca59fbdc-07fc-48f5-abcc-62ab4653f336.description: Beginning Aug. 12, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is temporarily extending the validity period for Form I-693, Report of Medical Examination and Vaccination Record, from two years to now four years due to COVID-19-related delays in processing.

9875fac3-0384-4f8c-996a-b5db238c289b.description: USCIS announced today that applicants filing for lawful permanent resident status are now able to apply for a Social Security number (SSN) or replacement card as part of the adjustment of status application process.

925e1f81-381f-4b4e-8b78-1815437d39df.creator: USCIS
925e1f81-381f-4b4e-8b78-1815437d39df.title: USCIS Removes Barriers to U.S. Citizenship for Children Born Abroad Through Assisted Reproductive Technology
925e1f81-381f-4b4e-8b78-1815437d39df.description: Today, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services announced updated policy guidance affecting children born outside of the United States and the determination of whether children born through assisted reproductive technology (ART) are considered to have been born “in wedlock.”

aa189ec2-d716-47a1-8189-d71f38ca4510.creator: USCIS
aa189ec2-d716-47a1-8189-d71f38ca4510.title: Registration Period Extended to 18 Months for TPS Applicants from Venezuela, Syria and Burma
aa189ec2-d716-47a1-8189-d71f38ca4510.description: WASHINGTON—The Department of Homeland Security today published a Federal Register notice (FRN) announcing extensions of the registration periods from 180 days to 18 months for initial (new) applicants for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) under the designations of Venezuela and Burma, and the redesignation of Syria. This notice also provides certain specific corrections to the FRN regarding Venezuela (86 FR 13574).

https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/ice-pr.description: Shant Ohanian, 38, of Burbank, was sentenced by U.S. District Judge John A.
